Message: Shall I tell you an old story?

The dull fable of
a nameless fortune teller—
the secret tale of her and I...

I was but a mere
fortune teller on the street...

My readings were renowned
for their accuracy,
so crowds would gather
around me day after day.
But, a reading is just a reading—

Nonetheless, not a day went by
without a visitor who had
complete trust in my
divinations.

I can’t take responsibility
for such blind faith...
No future is set in stone, after all.

The future is something
we shape with our own hands.
